content.description:
A long sport climb. From the base, climb up and generally right following bolts. All belays are bolted. You cannot get lost because there are sooooo many bolts. Most pitches are 35-45 m.

At the 10th pitch, head up and right— the line of bolts that goes straight up is Trans Canada. The final three pitches: go right and straight up (10a). Go hard right and up (10a). Go hard left and pull a crux mantle, then up a slab to the end (10b).  

The first three and final five pitches are the $$. 





Drive 13.1 km west from Revelstoke to a pullout on the right/north side of Victor Lake. There is a sign marking the trail. 

Head uphill to a junction 25 min. Turn right at junction and walk/scramble until you get to fixed ropes. Follow these until they end at the base of a slab with bolts.  

18 draws and 6-8 longer slings. 70m rope. The Beglinger guide recommends Camalots .4-#4. I’m not sure why— the route has billions of bolts.

The first 10.c was noticeably the hardest climb of the day.

Pitch 10 was so fun. The diagonal climbing on the jugs was sick.

Last pitch starts with a weird no feet super exposed move. The rest of the pitch is quite easy.



Follow the fixed rope to the start of return of the osprey. Follow the fixed rope for another 30m to the start of trans Canada.

Bolts

---



Located on the Victor Lake Wall. From the intersection of Hwy 1 and Hwy 23S, drive west on Hwy 1 for 13.1km. There is a gravel road on the north side of the hwy, directly below the wall. Drive 150m up the road and park at the end. Approach trail is next to parking, look for sign.

Link for more info.

https://www.revelstokerockclimbing.com/grags_routes_VictorLakeWall.html


Bolts, 18 - 20 draws recommended. Doable with 14 - 16 if you don't mind skipping a few
